item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. OpenCoder: Open-Source LLM for Coding (34 points | 3 comments)
2. Mergiraf: a syntax-aware merge driver for Git (246 points | 53 comments)
3. Windows Process Injection (4 points | discuss)
4. Show HN: HTML-to-Markdown – convert entire websites to Markdown with Golang/CLI (172 points | 39 comments)
5. Scientist treated her own cancer with viruses she grew in the lab (158 points | 68 comments)
6. Texture-Less Text Rendering (130 points | 40 comments)
7. Mitigating IP spoofing against Tor (30 points | 5 comments)
8. Trellis (YC W24) is hiring eng to turn documents into database ( | hide)
9. SVDQuant: 4-Bit Quantization Powers 12B Flux on a 16GB 4090 GPU with 3x Speedup (121 points | 34 comments)
10. The Saturn V FUELDRAULIC Gimbal System (1963) (23 points | 6 comments)
11. Memories are not only in the brain, human cell study finds (104 points | 44 comments)
12. Obtainium: Get Android App Updates Directly from the Source (109 points | 56 comments)
13. Nikolai Fyodorov wanted to resurrect the dead to live among the stars (21 points | 7 comments)
14. HPV vaccination: How the world can eliminate cervical cancer (199 points | 79 comments)
15. SQLite is not a single connection database (42 points | 17 comments)
16. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (242 points | 104 comments)
17. Notes on Guyana (68 points | 59 comments)
18. Ticketmaster’s attempt to game arbitration services fails (157 points | 29 comments)
19. Using Two ReMarkables (49 points | 19 comments)
20. Since the '60s, Ford has stored cars underground in a Kansas City cave (77 points | 22 comments)
21. Australia to ban under-16s from social media – but can't say how TikTok (11 points | 5 comments)
22. Gravity's Eastern Voyage (29 points | 3 comments)
23. Writing Tiny Desktop Apps in C and GTK3 (2022) (47 points | 10 comments)
24. A brief history of privacy protection on Macs (14 points | discuss)
25. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (523 points | 68 comments)
26. A CC-By Open-Source TTS Model with Voice Cloning (98 points | 20 comments)
27. Iterative α-(de)blending and Stochastic Interpolants (15 points | 1 comment)
28. Mitochondria Are Alive (578 points | 365 comments)
29. Segmenting Credit Card Customers with K-Means: A Fun Dive into Clustering (37 points | 21 comments)
30. Lynis – Security auditing and hardening tool, for Unix-based systems (30 points | 7 comments)
